content: the same color into it for the remainder of that pattern repeat thus you will produce a triangular section of skinny vertical stripes for each gusset when you get to the instep the blocks start again repeat the 2 row until you once again have 36 st in your sole this brings your total st count back to 72 when all decreases have been made in the two gusset areas you will have continuous blocks all around again continue to work in the pattern on the foot until you are about 3-2 inches short of the desired length of the sock and you can end with a row 9 knit 3 rounds with the multicolor yarn switch to solid color for the toe and knit until you are 1 75 inches short of the desired foot length and then begin working the toe decreases toe decreases you will be decreasing for the toe on both left and right sides of the instep and the sole 4 decreases on a decrease round in all again instructions are given for the round starting at the middle of the sole where your marker is located decrease as follows -row 1 starting at the marker on sole k to last 3 st of sole k2tog k1 on instep k1 ssk k instep until last 3 st k2tog k1 on sole k1 ssk k to end of round/marker -row 2 k all st when you encounter a ssk st from the previous row knit into the back of the loop to get it to lay down smoothly repeat these 2 row until there are 16 st each on sole and instep needles 32 st total in round graft* these together using kitchener st and your tapestry needle weave in all loose ends voila you have a sock now make another j * http //knitty com/issuesummer04/feattheresasum04 html is my fav kitchener st tutorial
